p: Among the isolated compounds, knipholone displayed the strongest anti-malarial activity against P. berghei infected mice (Table 4). Although knipholone and dianellin showed significant suppression at all dose levels tested, the former displayed superior activity with percent suppression values of 55.14 and 60.16% at doses of 100 and 200 mg/kg, respectively. Moreover, it significantly prolonged the mean survival days of the treatment groups (Table 4). The dose–response plot (Fig. 3) disclosed that the ED 50 values of knipholone and dianellin were 81.25 and 92.31 mg/kg, respectively. However, neither of the compounds caused significant difference in percent change of weight among the treated groups.
